intro: Goswamia trilokinathii, commonly known as the Trilokinath's goswamia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, thriving in the undergrowth of dense vegetation. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, with a distinct venation pattern. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
